revised_title: Investigations on the Effective Temperature of the Sun
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to determine the effective temperature of the Sun using a radiation balance method. They found a final mean result of 6200°C and discussed various factors affecting the measurement, such as the law connecting radiation and temperature, emissive power of platinum, and atmospheric absorption. The study suggests that a more systematic series of investigations in tropical regions could provide valuable insights into the solar temperature variations.
